definition: As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: The same tank but sanded nicely.
sentences.chinese: 同時，坦克，但用砂紙皆大歡喜。

sentences.english: I can't disclose that, but can say we're happy with the return.
sentences.chinese: 這點我不能透露，不過，投資的回報讓大家皆大歡喜。

sentences.english: Yi's signing is a happy ending for all parties.
sentences.chinese: 阿聯和雄鹿簽約，是一個皆大歡喜結局。

sentences.english: Publishers and advertisers will both be happy.
sentences.chinese: 發佈商和廣告主都會皆大歡喜。

sentences.english: Still, we promise we'll make an appearance. The appearance is an appeaser.
sentences.chinese: 我們仍然答應會出現，因爲這樣做皆大歡喜。

sentences.english: It would be good news all round.
sentences.chinese: 所以這會是一個皆大歡喜的好消息。

sentences.english: They weren't big on happy endings in the Dark Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在黑暗時代，故事總沒有皆大歡喜的結局。

definition: anew/from the beginning/(in poetry and song) repetition of a melody or rhythm
things like this (idiom); and so on/and the rest/etc
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
virtually the same/differing only on small points
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
